notes: Alleged NPA rebels attacked government forces in Goa area, Camarines Sur on 1st Jan 2016, breaking the ceasefire. No reported casualties.
Armed followers of Pata Mayor Anton Burahan and his nephew Al Sarapuddin clashed in Pata area, Sulu on 2 Jan 2016. Three persons were wounded.
Unidentified motorcycle-riding man shot dead an Army soldier, Samsudin Mokammad, at close range in Pagatin, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 2 Jan 2016.

Commuters staged a protest on 4 Jan 2016 at the Espana station of the Philippine National Railways (PNR) in Sampaloc, Manila, Metro Manila, demonstrating against the Light Railway Transit-Metro Rail Transit (LRT-MRT) fare hikes. [size=no report]

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Philippine Marine Corps
notes: Two Marine soldiers were killed during a clash with Abu Sayyaf at a military detachment in Talipao area, Sulu on 4 Jan 2016.

A local leader of the Liberal Party (LP) in Surigao del Norte who was shot on 4 Jan 2016 in Bacuag area, Surigao del Norte, died in a hospital on 15 Jan 2016 in Surigao City. The police is investigating whether the event was politically motivated.
A barangay chairman was killed by an unidentified motorcycle rider on 5th Jan in Silik, Pikit town, Cotabato. The killing was likely motivated by a rido and political interest.
Two feuding MILF commanders clashed on 7th Jan around Pikit town area, North Cotabato, 100 families were displaced. Reason for clash is long-standing feud. No fatalities reported.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: A CAFGU member was shot dead by suspected NPA on 7th Jan in brgy. Sagrada, Balatan town, Camarines Sur.
A farmer was shot dead by another farmer in Barangay Pinagpaanan, Talavera, Nueva Ecija on 7 Jan 2016 following a land dispute between the victim and three other farmers.
A Philippine Air Force (PAF) trooper was gunned down while on holiday near Jolo Church, Jolo, Sulu on 8 Jan 2016. Perpetrator is unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Philippines); NFSW: National Federation of Sugar Workers; Labour Group (Philippines); FAW: Federation of Agricultural Workers
notes: An agrarian reform beneficiary was abducted by unidentified men on 9 Jan 2016 in Barangay Lopez Jaena, Murcia, Negros Occidental and found dead the next day. The victim was a member of the National Federation of Sugar Workers (NFSW) in Negros Island, a member organization of the Federation of Agrarian Workers (FAW).

Armed men, allegedly led by Rommel Arnado who is the mayor of Kauswagan municipality, as well as members of the civil security unit shot at protesters outside the municipal hall in Kauswagan, Lanao del Norte on 9 Jan 2016, wounding at least three of them. Rommel Arnado is currently banned from running for elections and is in conflict with candidates for upcoming May 2016 elections, which could have served as a pretext for the event.

A peasant activist was shot dead by unidentified armed men in Barangay Central (Poblacion), Mati City, Davao Oriental on 11 Jan 2016. The victim was a chairman of the Fisherman Landless Association (FLA) and member of Indug Kautawan (People Stand Up) and had just settled a case of a farmer illegally arrested over a land dispute when the incident happened.

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016)
notes: A former police officer who was running for the May 2016 councillor elections was shot dead by two motorcycle-riding men in Placer, Surigao del Norte on 11 Jan 2016.

Detonation: On 11 Jan 2016, the military detonated a homemade bomb planted on a highway at Tacurong area, Sultan Kudarat. Perpetrator is unknown. Earlier, the police had disarmed another explosive device found on a bus going from Tacurong City.
A suspected New People's Army (NPA) member was killed and another member was captured during a firefight with the 4th Infantry Division at Barangay Kagawasan, Kibawe, Bukidnon on 12 Jan 2016.

Abu Sayyaf men led by Ninok Sapari and the 32nd Infantry Battalion clashed at Sitio Buanbuan, Barangay Latih, Patikul, Sulu on 12 Jan 2016. There were no casualties on the military side but the total number of casualties is unknown.
A drug suspect was gunned down by suspected vigilante militia on 12 Jan 2016 at Tugatog High School, Malabon, Metro Manila.
A town councillor candidate was gunned down near Cotabato City Plaza, Maguindanao on 13 Jan 2016. The perpetrator of the shooting is unknown, the motive could include clan war.

A pedicab driver and his baby daughter were gunned down by unidentified armed men on 13 Jan 2016 near Tugatog High School, Malabon, Metro Manila. Drug paraphernalia were allegedly found on the body of victim. The killing is being linked to the death of another man who was killed around Jan 12 on the same street.

A transmission tower in Barangay Pagangan, Aleosan, North Cotabato was bombed with improvised explosive devices that were triggered remotely. Perpetrators unknown. Since November 2015, 16 tower bombings have been registered in Mindanao, causing blackouts.
An improvised explosive device detonated near the highway in Purok Mirasol, Barangay Polomoguen, Midsayap, Cotabato on 14 Jan 2016 without causing any casualties. The perpetrator is unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: A Civilian Armed Forces Geographical Unit Active Auxiliary (CAFGU) member was killed when suspected New People's Army (NPA) members attacked the military base of the Army's 23rd Infantry Battalion in Barangay Manoligao area, Carmen, Agusan del Norte on 14 Jan 2016.
A village chief of Cabangcalan was shot dead by an unknown gunman on 15 Jan 2016 in Cabangcalan, Placer, Masbate.

Two locals were killed by alleged Maute group (report also described group as 'ISIS-affiliated jihadists') on 15 Jan 2016 in Brgy. Gata, Buadipuso Buntong, Lanao del Sur. The locals retaliated and killed one of the perpetrators.

15 January. Following the killing of two civilians (see above), the military pursued alleged Maute group members (report also described group as 'ISIS-affiliated jihadists'), encountering a different Maute group, killing one and wounding another Maute members at Barangay Lilod area, Maguing, Lanao del Sur on 15 Jan 2016.
A prominent drug dealer and gun trader was gunned down by the police on 16 Jan 2016 on Jagoliao island, Bohol. Drug paraphernalia were found near the scene.
Two New People's Army (NPA) members were killed and another one captured in a clash with the Army's 83rd Infantry Battalion Company on 18 Jan 2016 in Gibgos, Caramoan, Camarines Sur.
On 18 Jan 2016, five soldiers were wounded upon stepping on landmines planted by the New People's Army (NPA) near Sitio Lugpaton, Barangay King-King area in Pantukan, Davao de Oro.
A New People's Army (NPA) member was killed in a clash with the Army's 66th Infantry Battalion on 18 Jan 2016 in Barangay Pagsabangan area, New Bataan.
A soldier was wounded during a clash of the Army's 11th Infantry Battalion with 20 New People's Army (NPA) members on 18 Jan 2016 in Sitio Cantupa, Barangay Buenavista, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental.

A 15-year old student of the Salugpongan Community Learning Center from the Lumad ethnic group was shot dead by the Alamara militia on 18 Jan 2016 at Sitio Laslasakan, Barangay Palma Gil, Talaingod, Davao del Norte.
An improvised bomb exploded at the port in Lamitan, Basilan on 18 Jan 2016. There were no casualties. Investigations are underway to determine whether Abu Sayyaf was behind the bombings.
A peasant leader of Typhoon Pablo survivor group Barug Katawhan was shot dead by an intelligence officer (assumed police) in Barangay Lambajon, Baganga, Davao Oriental on 18 Jan 2016.
A transmission tower was bombed on 18 Jan 2016 in Barangay Pantar, Bubong, Lanao del Sur. Perpetrator is unknown.
A local leader of Nationalist People's Coalition (NPC) in Laguna was shot dead on 18 Jan 2016 in Barangay San Vicente, San Pedro, Laguna. Perpetrator is unknown.

A suspected bomber was killed in a shootout with the police on 19 Jan 2016 near Sitio Tinambakan, Barangay Maganda area, Lamitan City. Investigations are underway as to whether victim had links to Abu Sayyaf. Improvised bomb and methamphetamine recovered from location.

Local residents set up a barricade in Barangay Bayto, Candelaria, Zambales on 19 Feb 2016 in order to block trucks hauling nickel ore to port. Reports indicate that the barricade was maintained until at least February 2016.
Two men were killed in a raid by the Angeles city police on or around 20 Jan 2016 in Sapang Bato village, Angeles. One of the victims had an arrest warrant for drug charges and weapons possession.

Agreement: An Abu Sayyaf leader, Sulaiman Kasaran, and six other Abu Sayyaf members surrendered to the military on 21 Jan 2016 in Sitio Camalig, Barangay Bohe Pahu, Ungkaya Pukan following negotiations. This is the first instance of Abu Sayyaf members surrendering with the purpose of reintegration.

A suspected drug dealer was killed while eight other suspects were arrested during a raid by joint security forces (military, PDEA, police) on 22 Jan 2016 in Sitio Canas, Barangay Calangcanas, Maluso town, Basilan.

Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) set fire on a depot of the construction company AJ Construction Co. in Barangay Edwards, T'boli, South Cotabato on 22 Jan 2016. Reasons for torching are extortion demands by the NPA.
A bomb allegedly planted by Abu Sayyaf exploded on or around 23 Jan 2016 in Barangay Malakas, Lamitan City, Basilan.

actor1: PMLP: Marxist-Leninist Party of the Philippines
notes: Members of the leftist group Partisano (part of the Marxist-Leninist Party of the Philippines (MLPP)) shot dead a Malabon City councillor in Perlas Street, Malabon City, Metro Manila on 23 Jan 2016.

Students of the University of the Philippines Diliman and youth groups staged a protest at the Commission on Higher Education (Ched), Quezon City, Metro Manila on 23 Jan 2016 to demonstrate against the K to 12 program and curricular reforms.
A bomb allegedly planted by Abu Sayyaf exploded on or around 23 Jan 2016 in Barangay Malinis, Lamitan City, Basilan.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) attacked an army outpost belonging to the Philippine army and the Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit on 23 Jan 2016 in Barangay Pagangan in Aleosan, North Cotabato and exchanged fire with the military.

actor2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Special Action Force
notes: Defusal: On 23 Jan 2016 (other source mentions that device was found on 16 Jan 2016), government security forces (police Special Action Force) seized and detonated an improvised explosive device (IED) that had been planted by Abu Sayyaf in Barangay San Raymundo, Jolo, Sulu.

The military attacked Abu Sayyaf and Maute group positions in Butig area, Lanao del Sur through air strikes around 24 Jan 2016, killing at least 15 fighters. Investigations are under way whether an Indonesian was among the victims.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) attacked an army outpost on 24 Jan 2016 in Barangay Nalapaan in Pikit, North Cotabato. Four BIFF members were wounded in the exchange of fire.

Two police officers and two civilians were wounded during an ambush by unidentified men in Sitio Maturi, Barangay Santo Nino, Sibuco, Zamboanga on 24 Jan 2016. Possible suspects include the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF).
Agreement: A peace agreement to end a bloody land dispute over Datu Abdullah Sangki farms had been signed between the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) and the government on or around 25 Jan 2016.
A Philippine Air Force member was shot dead during a clash between New People's Army (NPA) and soldiers of the 730th Combat Group on 25 Jan 2016 in Barangay Toong in Tuy town, Batangas.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire at a Vice Mayor of Don Victoriano Chiongbian town in Misamis Occidental and two of her companions on 25 Jan 2016 in Barangay Tuno in Don Victoriano Chiongbian Town. The Vice Mayor escaped unscathed while her two companions were injured.
A police officer was killed in an ambush by unidentified motorcycle-riding men on 25 Jan 2016 in Barangay Mahabang Dahilig Road, Lemery, Batangas. Motives of the event are under investigation.
On 26 January 2016, a teacher was fired upon by suspected NPA rebels in Palma Gil, Talaingod, Davao del Norte.
Three soldiers of the 50th Infantry Battalion of the 5th Infantry Division were killed during a clash with the New People's Army (NPA) on 26 Jan 2016 in Balbalan, Kalinga.

A watchman of the National Grid Corporation of the Philippines (NGCP) and two of his family members including a baby were injured during a grenade attack on 26 Jan 2016 in Barangay Inug-og area, Pikit, North Cotabato.
A New People's Army (NPA) member was killed during a clash with the Army's 73rd Infantry Battalion in Sitio Tinungkaan in Barangay Danwata, Malita, Davao Occidental.

source: Manila Times; Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: An female anti-mining activist of the Save Pantukan Movement, a network of indigenous people from the Pantukan region, died on 30 Jan 2016 in the hospital following a assassination attempt by suspected elements of the 46th Infantry Battalion on 27 Jan 2016 in Purok Bardown in Pantukan town area, Davao de Oro according to human rights group Karapatan.
An unidentified gunman killed the village chairman of Upper Tungawan and town councillor candidate on 27 Jan 2016 in Barangay Upper Tungawan, Zamboanga Sibugay.

The women's group Lila Pilipina (uniting former 'comfort women' abused during World War II) staged a protest at the Chino Roces bridge, Manila, Metro Manila on 27 Jan 2016 demanding an apology from Emperor Akihito of Japan and reparation to all 'comfort women'.

A New People's Army (NPA) member was killed in a clash with the military on 27 Jan 2016 in Camarines Norte. The NPA rebel was from Barangay Magsaysay in Capalonga town area, although there are no further details as to the specific location of the incident.
Defusal: The police defused an improvised bomb that had been thrown by Abu Sayyaf members at a police patrol car on 27 Jan 2016 in Street 6 in Kalasamatan Village, Barangay San Raymundo, Jolo, Sulu.
An anti-large-scale mining activist was attacked and wounded by suspected members of the Army's 46th Infantry Battalion on 28 Jan 2016 in Pantukan town, Davao de Oro.
Senior citizens staged a protest on 28 Jan 2016 at the Social Security System (SSS) Branch in Pasig City, Metro Manila against President Aquino's veto of pension increases.
Defusal: On 28 Jan 2016, the military deactivated a bomb planted at Shariff Aguak bus terminal. The reason for the bomb placement could include an attempt to extort money from the Husky Bus company.
Abu Sayyaf members Namil Ahajari and Roger Saji bombed a karaoke bar (assumed closed) in Jolo area, Sulu. No-one was hurt but the bar suffered damages.
Defusal: On 28 Jan 2016, the police recovered an improvised explosive device planted by suspected Abu Sayyaf near Mabuhay Trading at Roxas Ave. in Isabela City.

The College Editors Guild of the Philippines (CEGP) and other youth organizations staged a protest on 29 Jan 2016 at the Department of Justice (DOJ) in Manila, Metro Manila demanding the release of youth political prisoners.

Property destruction: Around 29 Jan 2016, the New People's Army (NPA) carried out a series of coordinated attacks targeting the property of Del Monte Philippines Inc. (DMPI) in various locations in Malaybalay City area, Bukidnon.

31 January. A soldier of the First Scout Ranger Battalion was killed and two more members were wounded during an ambush staged by the Abu Sayyaf on 31 Jan 2016 in Barangay Anoling, Patikul, Sulu. Other articles mentioned that the event took place on Feb 1.

actor1: RPA-ABB: Revolutionary Proletarian Army-Alex Boncayao Brigade
notes: On 31 Jan 2016, in Iloilo province, a peasant leader of the Leon United Peasants Alliance was shot dead by members of the RPA-ABB (coded the capital of Iloilo as location with GP 2).
